tags.name: Test  Suites
tags.description: Test suites help in organizing test cases in a test plan. A test suite can contain multiple child test suites, helping you build a folder structure under a test plan, or it can contain test cases. Last child test suites typically contain test cases, whereas intermediate suites represent a structure hierarchy. Intermediate suites can only be Static type, whereas last child suites can be of static suites, requirement-based suites, or query-based suites.

tags.name: Test Cases
tags.description: Controller to handle TestCase REST calls

get.description: Get code coverage data for a build.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: buildId
parameters.description: ID of the build for which code coverage data needs to be fetched.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: Value of flags determine the level of code coverage details to be fetched. Flags are additive. Expected Values are 1 for Modules, 2 for Functions, 4 for BlockData.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: suiteId
parameters.description: ID of the suite that contains the points.

parameters.name: witFields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of work item field names.

parameters.name: configurationId
parameters.description: Get test points for specific configuration.

parameters.name: testCaseId
parameters.description: Get test points for a specific test case, valid when configurationId is not set.

parameters.name: testPointIds
parameters.description: Get test points for comma-separated list of test point IDs, valid only when configurationId and testCaseId are not set.

parameters.name: includePointDetails
parameters.description: Include all properties for the test point.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of test points to skip..

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of test points to return.

Workitems associated with a test result.
Subresults in a test result.
Point and plan detail in a test result.

get.description: Get iterations for a result

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: runId
parameters.description: ID of the test run that contains the result.

parameters.name: testCaseResultId
parameters.description: ID of the test result that contains the iterations.

parameters.name: includeActionResults
parameters.description: Include result details for each action performed in the test iteration. ActionResults refer to outcome (pass/fail) of test steps that are executed as part of a running a manual test. Including the ActionResults flag gets the outcome of test steps in the actionResults section and test parameters in the parameters section for each test iteration.

ActionResults refer to outcome (pass/fail) of test steps that are executed as part of a running a manual test. Including the ActionResults flag gets the outcome of test steps in the actionResults section and test parameters in the parameters section for each test iteration.

parameters.description: Period in days from now, for which test sessions are fetched.

parameters.description: If true, it returns all properties of the test sessions. Otherwise, it returns the skinny version.

parameters.description: Source of the test session.

values.description: Source of test session uncertain as it is stale
The session was created from Microsoft Test Manager exploratory desktop tool.
The session was created from feedback client.
The session was created from browser extension.
The session was created from browser extension.
The session was created from web access using Microsoft Test Manager exploratory desktop tool.
To show sessions from all supported sources.

parameters.name: includeOnlyCompletedSessions
parameters.description: If true, it returns test sessions in completed state. Otherwise, it returns test sessions for all states

parameters.name: body

get.description: Query Test Runs based on filters. Mandatory fields are minLastUpdatedDate and maxLastUpdatedDate.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The name of the Azure DevOps organization.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project ID or project name

parameters.name: minLastUpdatedDate
parameters.description: Minimum Last Modified Date of run to be queried (Mandatory).

parameters.name: maxLastUpdatedDate
parameters.description: Maximum Last Modified Date of run to be queried (Mandatory, difference between min and max date can be atmost 7 days).

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Current state of the Runs to be queried.

values.description: Only used during an update to preserve the existing value.
The run is still being created.  No tests have started yet.
Tests are running.
All tests have completed or been skipped.
Run is stopped and remaining tests have been aborted
Run is currently initializing This is a legacy state and should not be used any more
Run requires investigation because of a test point failure This is a legacy state and should not be used any more

parameters.name: planIds
parameters.description: Plan Ids of the Runs to be queried, comma separated list of valid ids (limit no. of ids 10).

parameters.name: isAutomated
parameters.description: Automation type of the Runs to be queried.

parameters.name: publishContext
parameters.description: PublishContext of the Runs to be queried.

values.description: Run is published for Build Context.
Run is published for Release Context.
Run is published for any Context.

parameters.name: buildIds
parameters.description: Build Ids of the Runs to be queried, comma separated list of valid ids (limit no. of ids 10).

parameters.name: buildDefIds
parameters.description: Build Definition Ids of the Runs to be queried, comma separated list of valid ids (limit no. of ids 10).

parameters.name: branchName
parameters.description: Source Branch name of the Runs to be queried.

parameters.name: releaseIds
parameters.description: Release Ids of the Runs to be queried, comma separated list of valid ids (limit no. of ids 10).

parameters.name: releaseDefIds
parameters.description: Release Definition Ids of the Runs to be queried, comma separated list of valid ids (limit no. of ids 10).

parameters.name: releaseEnvIds
parameters.description: Release Environment Ids of the Runs to be queried, comma separated list of valid ids (limit no. of ids 10).

parameters.name: releaseEnvDefIds
parameters.description: Release Environment Definition Ids of the Runs to be queried, comma separated list of valid ids (limit no. of ids 10).

parameters.name: runTitle
parameters.description: Run Title of the Runs to be queried.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of runs to be queried. Limit is 100

parameters.name: continuationToken
parameters.description: continuationToken received from previous batch or null for first batch. It is not supposed to be created (or altered, if received from last batch) by user.

ActualTestResultSettings.description: Actual Test Result Settings for a Test Plan

isActualTestResultEnabled.description: Enable actual results field usage for test step result in the test plan during test execution

isActualTestResultMandatory.description: Mandate actual results field usage for test step result in the test plan during test execution

lookbackPeriod.description: Lookback period for the parameter in multiple of 24 hours

values.description: Failure rate parameter for flaky detection
Pass rate parameter for flaky detection
Timing variability parameter for flaky detection
Rerun count parameter for flaky detection

weight.description: Weight for the parameter. Values between 0-100

filingBugThreshold.description: Threshold for filing a bug for a flaky test.

markingFlakyThreshold.description: Threshold for marking a test as flaky.

weightedScores.description: List of parameters with their weights for advanced flaky detection.

auxiliaryUrl.description: Auxiliary Url to be consumed by MTM

fileName.description: File name of the attachment created

id.description: ID of AfnStrip. This is same as the attachment ID.

storedIn.description: Service in which this attachment is stored in

unCompressedStreamLength.description: Byte stream (uncompressed) length of Afn strip.

AggregatedResultDetailsByOutcome.description: Result deatils for a particular test result outcome.

count.description: Number of results for current outcome.

values.description: Only used during an update to preserve the existing value.
Test has not been completed, or the test type does not report pass/failure.
Test was executed w/o any issues.
Test was executed, but there were issues. Issues may involve exceptions or failed assertions.
Test has completed, but we can't say if it passed or failed. May be used for aborted tests...
The test timed out
Test was aborted. This was not caused by a user gesture, but rather by a framework decision.
Test had it chance for been executed but was not, as ITestElement.IsRunnable == false.
Test was not executed. This was caused by a user gesture - e.g. user hit stop button.
To be used by Run level results. This is not a failure.
There was a system error while we were trying to execute a test.
Test is Not Applicable for execution.
Test is paused.
Test is currently executing. Added this for TCM charts
Test is not impacted. Added fot TIA.
Only used during an update to preserve the existing value.
Test has not been completed, or the test type does not report pass/failure.
Test was executed w/o any issues.
Test was executed, but there were issues. Issues may involve exceptions or failed assertions.
Test has completed, but we can't say if it passed or failed. May be used for aborted tests...
The test timed out
Test was aborted. This was not caused by a user gesture, but rather by a framework decision.
Test had it chance for been executed but was not, as ITestElement.IsRunnable == false.
Test was not executed. This was caused by a user gesture - e.g. user hit stop button.
To be used by Run level results. This is not a failure.
There was a system error while we were trying to execute a test.
Test is Not Applicable for execution.
Test is paused.
Test is currently executing. Added this for TCM charts
Test is not impacted. Added fot TIA.
Run with zero failed tests and has at least one impacted test
Run with at-least one failed test.
Run with no impacted tests.
Runs with All tests in other category.
Only used during an update to preserve the existing value.
The run is still being created.  No tests have started yet.
Tests are running.
All tests have completed or been skipped.
Run is stopped and remaining tests have been aborted
Run is currently initializing This is a legacy state and should not be used any more
Run requires investigation because of a test point failure This is a legacy state and should not be used any more

branchName.description: Branch name - simple name or full Git reference

branchType.description: Branch reference type. Optional, defaults to 'none' if not specified.

values.description: Undefined branch type
Branch reference
Tag reference
Pull request reference

branchName.description: Branch name for which build is generated.

sourceVersion.description: Source Version(/first commit) for the build was triggered.

completionDate.description: If the operation is complete, the DateTime of completion. If operation is not complete, this is DateTime.MaxValue

creationDate.description: DateTime when the operation was started

message.description: If the operation has Failed, Message contains the reason for failure. Null otherwise.

resultObjectType.description: The type of the object generated as a result of the Clone operation

values.description: Suite Clone
Plan Clone

state.description: Current state of the operation. When State reaches Succeeded or Failed, the operation is complete

values.description: value for Failed State
value for Inprogress state
Value for Queued State
value for Success state

url.description: Url for getting the clone information

CloneOptions.description: Clone options for cloning the test suite.

cloneRequirements.description: If set to true requirements will be cloned

copyAllSuites.description: copy all suites from a source plan

destinationWorkItemType.description: Name of the workitem type of the clone

overrideParameters.description: Key value pairs where the key value is overridden by the value.

relatedLinkComment.description: Comment on the link that will link the new clone  test case to the original Set null for no comment

clonedRequirementsCount.description: Number of requirements cloned so far.

clonedSharedStepsCount.description: Number of shared steps cloned so far.

clonedTestCasesCount.description: Number of test cases cloned so far

totalRequirementsCount.description: Total number of requirements to be cloned

totalTestCasesCount.description: Total number of test cases to be cloned

includeAttachments.description: If set to true, include the attachments

includeLinks.description: If set to true, include the links

relatedLinkComment.description: Comment on the link that will link the new clone  test case to the original Set null for no comment

CodeCoverageData.description: Represents the build configuration (platform, flavor) and coverage data for the build

buildFlavor.description: Flavor of build for which data is retrieved/published

buildPlatform.description: Platform of build for which data is retrieved/published

coverageStats.description: List of coverage data for the build

CodeCoverageStatistics.description: Represents the code coverage statistics for a particular coverage label (modules, statements, blocks, etc.)

CodeCoverageSummary.description: Represents the code coverage summary results Used to publish or retrieve code coverage summary against a build

build.description: Uri of build for which data is retrieved/published

coverageData.description: List of coverage data and details for the build

values.description: No coverage status
The summary evaluation is in progress
The summary evaluation is finalized and won't change
The summary evaluation is pending
Summary evaluation may be ongoing but another merge has been requested.
No coverage modules found
Number of Files exceeded
TNo Input Files
Build got cancelled by user
Coverage Jobs failed
Module merge Timeout
Coverage successfully completed
Invalid Build Configuration
Coverage Analyzer Build not found
Failed to requeue the build
Build got Bailed out
No Code coverage configured
CoverageMerge Job failed
CoverageMergeInvoker Job failed
CoverageMonitor Job failed
CoverageMergeInvoker Job timeout
CoverageMonitor Job timeout
Invalid Coverage Input file

deltaBuild.description: Uri of build against which difference in coverage is computed

status.description: Uri of build against which difference in coverage is computed

values.description: No coverage status
The summary evaluation is in progress
The summary evaluation for the previous request is completed. Summary can change in future
The summary evaluation is finalized and won't change
The summary evaluation is pending
Summary evaluation may be ongoing but another merge has been requested.

CustomTestField.description: A custom field information. Allowed Key : Value pairs - ( AttemptId: int value, IsTestResultFlaky: bool)

fieldName.description: Name of the Custom Test Field

value.description: 1. If the CustomTestField is registered as Bit data type, value should be sent as case insensitive string - either "true" or "false". 2. If the CustomTestField is registered as Datetime data type, value should be sent as string in the format of "YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss" 3. If the CustomTestField is registered as Int data type, value should be sent as string representation of 32 bit signed integer. Ex: "5". 4. If the CustomTestField is registered as Float data type, value should be sent as string for example "4.237" 5. If the CustomTestField is registered as String data type, Any string up to 1kB is accepted. 6. If the CustomTestField is registered as Guid, value should be sent as case insensitive string representation of GUID in usual format "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX" where X can be either number 0-9 or letter A-F. For example "f88d6b84-3549-4af0-a4f4-58139cd0a14f".

CustomTestFieldDefinition.description: Data structure which stores details for the customTestFields to be updated

fieldId.description: ID assigned to the custom test field upon creation, should be left empty when creating.

fieldName.description: The name of custom field cannot be longer than 50 characters (spaces, numbers, and special characters are not allowed) and must be unique in the project. The names are case insensitive.

values.description: Boolean data type.
Datetime data type.
Integer data type.
Floating integer data type.
String data type.
Unique identifier data type.

scope.description: Artifact to which customTestField will be set.

values.description: Custom field can be used with TestRun artifact.
Custom field can be used with TestResult artifact.
Custom test field can be used with either TestRun or TestResult artifact.
Reserved for internal Azure DevOps functionality. Not to be used.

fieldId.description: Custom test field id which is to be updated.

fieldName.description: The name of custom field cannot be longer than 50 characters(spaces, numbers, and special characters are not allowed) and must be unique in the project.CustomTestField name is case insensitive.

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

directoryAlias.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph user referenced in the "self" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

imageUrl.description: Deprecated - Available in the "avatar" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

inactive.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph membership state referenced in the "membershipState" entry of the GraphUser "_links" dictionary

isAadIdentity.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsAadUserType/Descriptor.IsAadGroupType)

isContainer.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsGroupType)

profileUrl.description: Deprecated - not in use in most preexisting implementations of ToIdentityRef

JobReference.description: Job in pipeline. This is related to matrixing in YAML.

jobName.description: Matrixing in YAML generates copies of a job with different inputs in matrix. JobName is the name of those input. Maximum supported length for name is 256 character.

duration.description: Duration of the last result in milliseconds.

runBy.description: The user who executed the last result.

timeline.description: Session Machine timeline Valid values for "type" property = (Requested, Ready, Released)

logNewTests.description: LogNewTests defines whether or not we will record new test cases coming into the system

phaseName.description: Name of the phase. Maximum supported length for name is 256 character.

pipelineId.description: Reference of the pipeline with which this pipeline instance is related.

currentContext.description: Reference of Pipeline instance for which test summary is calculated.

PlanUpdateModel.description: A model class used for creating and updating test plans.

actualTestResultSettings.description: Actual Test Result Settings for the test plan.

area.description: Area path to which the test plan belongs. This should be set to area path of the team that works on this test plan.

build.description: Build ID of the build whose quality is tested by the tests in this test plan. For automated testing, this build ID is used to find the test binaries that contain automated test methods.

buildDefinition.description: The Build Definition that generates a build associated with this test plan.

configurationIds.description: IDs of configurations to be applied when new test suites and test cases are added to the test plan.

endDate.description: End date for the test plan.

iteration.description: Iteration path assigned to the test plan. This indicates when the target iteration by which the testing in this plan is supposed to be complete and the product is ready to be released.

releaseEnvironmentDefinition.description: Release Environment to be used to deploy the build and run automated tests from this test plan.

startDate.description: Start date for the test plan.

yamlReleaseReference.description: The Yaml Release Reference associated with this test plan.

PointAssignment.description: Adding test cases to a suite creates one of more test points based on the default configurations and testers assigned to the test suite. PointAssignment is the list of test points that were created for each of the test cases that were added to the test suite.

configuration.description: Configuration that was assigned to the test case.

tester.description: Tester that was assigned to the test case

testcaseIds.description: List of test case id for filtering.

workItem.description: key value pair of test point work item property.

bag.description: Generic store for test session data

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

definitionId.description: ID of the release definition that contains the release environment definition.

environmentDefinitionId.description: ID of the release environment definition.

automatedResultsRetentionDuration.description: Automated test result retention duration in days

manualResultsRetentionDuration.description: Manual test result retention duration in days

previousContext.description: Reference of pipeline instance from which to compare the results.

testFailuresAnalysis.description: Failure analysis of results with respect to PreviousContext

aggregatedResultDetailsByOutcome.description: Aggregated result details for each test result outcome.

resultSummaryByRunState.description: Result summary of pipeline, group by TestRun state.

count.description: Test result count fo the given outcome.

values.description: Rerun metadata
Flaky metadata

RunSummary.description: Summary of runs for a pipeline instance.

duration.description: Total time taken by runs with state completed and NeedInvestigation.

runSummaryByOutcome.description: Runs count by outcome for runs with state completed and NeedInvestigation runs.

RunSummaryModel.description: Run summary for each output type of test.

resultCount.description: Number of results for Outcome TestOutcome

values.description: Only used during an update to preserve the existing value.
Test has not been completed, or the test type does not report pass/failure.
Test was executed w/o any issues.
Test was executed, but there were issues. Issues may involve exceptions or failed assertions.
Test has completed, but we can't say if it passed or failed. May be used for aborted tests...
The test timed out
Test was aborted. This was not caused by a user gesture, but rather by a framework decision.
Test had it chance for been executed but was not, as ITestElement.IsRunnable == false.
Test was not executed. This was caused by a user gesture - e.g. user hit stop button.
To be used by Run level results. This is not a failure.
There was a system error while we were trying to execute a test.
Test is Not Applicable for execution.
Test is paused.
Test is currently executing. Added this for TCM charts
Test is not impacted. Added fot TIA.

ShallowReference.description: An abstracted reference to some other resource. This class is used to provide the build data contracts with a uniform way to reference other resources in a way that provides easy traversal through links.

links.description: Source links Valid values for "type" property = (SessionInfo, ResubmitSession)

requirementIds.description: For requirements test suites, the IDs of the requirements.

suiteType.description: Type of test suite to create. It can have value from DynamicTestSuite, StaticTestSuite and RequirementTestSuite.

childSuiteId.description: Id of child suite in the test suite.

sequenceNumber.description: Sequence number for the test case or child test suite in the test suite.

testCaseId.description: Id of a test case in the test suite.

project.description: The team project Id or name.  Ignored if ProjectId is set.

team.description: The Team Id or name.  Ignored if TeamId is set.

defaultTeamImageUrl.description: Url to default team identity image.

values.description: Project is in the process of being deleted.
Project is in the process of being created.
Project is completely created and ready to use.
Project has been queued for creation, but the process has not yet started.
All projects regardless of state except Deleted.
Project has not been changed.
Project has been deleted.

url.description: Url to the full version of the object.

values.description: The project is only visible to users with explicit access.
The project is visible to all.

actionPath.description: Path identifier for test step in test case workitem. Note: 1) It is represented in Hexadecimal format with 8 digits for a step. 2) Internally, the step ID value for first step starts with 2 so actionPath = 00000002 step 9, will have an ID = 10 and actionPath = 0000000a step 15, will have an ID =16 and actionPath = 00000010 3) actionPath of shared step is concatenated with the parent step of test case. Example, it would be something of type -  0000000300000001 where 00000003 denotes action path of test step and 00000001 denotes action path for shared step

actualResultMessage.description: Actual result message of test action result.

iterationId.description: Iteration ID of test action result.

stepIdentifier.description: This is step Id of test case. For shared step, it is step Id of shared step in test case workitem; step Id in shared step. Example: TestCase workitem has two steps: 1) Normal step with Id = 1 2) Shared Step with Id = 2. Inside shared step: a) Normal Step with Id = 1 Value for StepIdentifier for First step: "1" Second step: "2;1"

url.description: Url of test action result. Deprecated in hosted environment.

classificationCategory.description: classification category of the group Allowable values: 'Critical', 'System', 'Discounted'

displayTitle.description: title of the analysis category display

values.description: Attachment type GeneralAttachment , use this as default type unless you have other type.
Attachment type CodeCoverage.
Attachment type ConsoleLog.

attachmentType.description: Attachment type By Default it will be GeneralAttachment. It can be one of the following type. { GeneralAttachment, AfnStrip, BugFilingData, CodeCoverage, IntermediateCollectorData, RunConfig, TestImpactDetails, TmiTestRunDeploymentFiles, TmiTestRunReverseDeploymentFiles, TmiTestResultDetail, TmiTestRunSummary }

values.description: Default
The test point needs to be executed in order for the test pass to be considered complete.  Either the test has not been run before or the previous run failed.
The test has passed successfully and does not need to be re-run for the test pass to be considered complete.
The test point needs to be executed but is not able to.
The test is being executed.

continuationToken.description: It will be filled by server. If not null means there are some results still to be get, and we need to call this REST API with this ContinuousToken. It is not supposed to be created (or altered, if received from server in last batch) by user.

Session result with Passed
Session result with Failed

Session state with Running

advancedFlakyDetectionSettings.description: Advanced system flaky detection settings Contains parameter configurations for failure rate, pass rate, timing variability, and rerun count

flakySettings.description: IsRequired and EmitDefaultValue are passed as false as if users doesn't pass anything, should not come for serialisation and deserialisation.

newTestResultLoggingSettings.description: NewTestResultLoggingSettings defines the setting for logging new test results

build.description: Build associated with this test run.

buildConfiguration.description: Build configuration details associated with this test run.

comment.description: Comments entered by those analyzing the run.

completedDate.description: Completed date time of the run.

customFields.description: List of Custom Fields for TestRun.

dropLocation.description: Drop Location for the test Run.

dueDate.description: Due date and time for test run.

errorMessage.description: Error message associated with the run.

isAutomated.description: true if test run is automated, false otherwise.

iteration.description: The iteration to which the run belongs.

lastUpdatedBy.description: Team foundation ID of the last updated the test run.

owner.description: Team Foundation ID of the owner of the runs.

passedTests.description: Number of passed tests in the run

pipelineReference.description: Reference of the pipeline to which this test run belongs.

plan.description: Test plan associated with this test run.

release.description: Release Reference for the Test Run.

startedDate.description: Start date time of the run.

state.description: The state of the run. Type TestRunState Valid states - Unspecified ,NotStarted, InProgress, Completed, Waiting, Aborted, NeedsInvestigation

values.description: Run with noState.
Run state while Creating Environment.

Run state while Creating Environment.

Run state when cancellation is in Progress.

tags.description: Tags attached with this test run.

testEnvironment.description: Test environment associated with the run.

unanalyzedTests.description: Number of failed tests in the run.

area.description: Area path of the test session

project.description: Project to which the test session belongs

propertyBag.description: Generic store for test session data

values.description: Source of test session uncertain as it is stale

associatedWorkItems.description: Workitem references of workitems filed as a part of the current workitem exploration.

endTime.description: Time when exploration of workitem ended.

startTime.description: Time when explore of workitem was started.

severity.description: Notification Severity Valid values = (Informational, Warning, Error, Critical)

TestSessionTestRun.description: Notifications for the Test Session Test Run

testRuns.description: Set of testRunIds for a test Session

TestSettings.description: Represents the test settings of the run. Used to create test settings and fetch test settings

areaPath.description: Area path required to create test settings

description.description: Description of the test settings. Used in create test settings.

isPublic.description: Indicates if the tests settings is public or private.Used in create test settings.

machineRoles.description: Xml string of machine roles. Used in create test settings.

TestSettings2.description: Represents the test settings of the run. Used to create test settings and fetch test settings

areaPath.description: Area path required to create test settings

description.description: Description of the test settings. Used in create test settings.

isPublic.description: Indicates if the tests settings is public or private.Used in create test settings.

machineRoles.description: Xml string of machine roles. Used in create test settings.

TestSubResult.description: Represents a sub result of a test result.

parentId.description: Immediate parent ID of sub result.

resultGroupType.description: Hierarchy type of the result, default value of None means its leaf node.

values.description: Leaf node of test result.
Hierarchy type of test result.
Hierarchy type of test result.
Hierarchy type of test result.
Unknown hierarchy type.

subResults.description: List of sub results inside a sub result, if ResultGroupType is not None, it holds corresponding type sub results.

areaUri.description: Area uri of the test suite.

children.description: Child test suites of current test suite.

inheritDefaultConfigurations.description: Default configuration was inherited or not.

lastUpdatedBy.description: IdentityRef of user who has updated test suite recently.

plan.description: Test plan to which the test suite belongs.

queryString.description: Test suite query string, for dynamic suites.

suites.description: List of shallow reference of suites.

text.description: Used in tree view. If test suite is root suite then, it is name of plan otherwise title of the suite.

cloneOptions.description: Clone options for cloning the test suite.

destinationSuiteId.description: Suite id under which, we have to clone the suite.

TestTag.description: Tag attached to a run or result.

name.description: Name of the tag, alphanumeric value less than 30 chars

TestTagSummary.description: Test tag summary for build or release grouped by test run.

tagsGroupByTestArtifact.description: Dictionary which contains tags associated with a test run.

TestTagsUpdateModel.description: Tags to update to a run or result.

project.description: Project to which the test variable belongs

values.description: List of allowed values
